IM can be easily extended with so-called plugins, very much the same as jQuery allows writing plugins. You can create both custom IM functions and custom IM chains.

Creating custom functions

Creating custom functions is as easy as adding a property to the 'im' object:

(function(){ im.custom = function(element) { // do something }; })();

Creating custom chains

Creating custom chains is as easy as adding a property to the 'im.chains' object:

(function(){ im.chains.redBorder = function() { for (var x = 0; x < this.length; x++) { // do something with this[x] this[x].style.border = '1px solid red'; } return this; // don't forget or you will break the chain }; im.chains.padding = function(value) { if (value || value == '') { // setting for (var x = 0; x < this.length; x++) { this[x].style.padding = value; // set padding for each item in the chain } return this; // don't break the chain } else if (this.length > 0){ return this[0].style.padding; // break the chain when getting } } })();
